div.h1: Pre-registration is now open for Kindergarten and Preschool.

div.p: Pre-registration is now open for Kindergarten and Preschool. Please see the information here to pre-register your child.

div.h1: GOVERNOR BESHEAR ANNOUNCES IN-PERSON CLASSES WILL NOT RESUME THIS SCHOOL YEAR.

div.p:
Cynthiana, Kentucky (April 20, 2020) - Today at approximately 2:20, Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear announced to Kentucky's superintendents that schools would not be able to return to regular in-person classes for the remainder of the current school year.
For the full article, click here.

div.h1: Harrison County Schools making changes to food service program

div.p: Harrison County Schools' meal service program is undergoing some changes starting Monday, April 20, 2020. Visit https://www.harrison.kyschools.us/News/152#sthash.QzAzH0S2.dpbs for more details.

div.a: Governor Beshear Announces In-Person Classes Will Not Resume This School Year. Harrison County School District Provides Updated Information

div.a: Harrison County Schools making changes to food service program

span.p: Starting Monday, April 20, 2020, several changes will be made in Harrison County Schools’ feeding program.
These changes are designed to limit contact in order to protect district staff and the community and prevent the spread of Covid-19.

div.a: NTI packets available in one location

span.p: Non-Traditional Instruction (NTI) packets are available for all grades at the links below. Below the links is pickup and/or delivery information for each individual school.

div.a: Harrison County Schools to continue Non-Traditional Instruction through May 1

span.p: Working under the advice of Gov. Andy Beshear and Kentucky Department of Education Interim Commissioner Kevin Brown, Harrison County Schools will continue operation on a Non-Traditional Instruction (NTI) schedule through May 1, 2020. All extra-curricular and scheduled events have been cancelled through this date.
